pkgmetadata.longdescription: Python extension to AstroDienst Swiss Ephemeris library.The Swiss Ephemeris is the de-facto standard library for astrologicalcalculations. It is a high-precision ephemeris, based upon the DE431ephemerides from NASA's JPL, and covering the time range 13201 BC to AD 17191.:: >>> import swisseph as swe >>> # first set path to ephemeris files >>> swe.set_ephe_path('/usr/share/sweph/ephe') >>> # find time of next lunar eclipse >>> jd = swe.julday(2007, 3, 3) # julian day >>> res = swe.lun_eclipse_when(jd) >>> ecltime = swe.revjul(res[1][0]) >>> print(ecltime) (2007, 3, 3, 23.347926892340183) >>> # get ecliptic position of asteroid 13681 "Monty Python" >>> jd = swe.julday(2008, 3, 21) >>> xx, rflags = swe.calc_ut(jd, swe.AST_OFFSET+13681) >>> # print longitude >>> print(xx[0]) 0.09843983166646618:Documentation: https://astrorigin.com/pyswisseph:Repository: https://github.com/astrorigin/pyswisseph
